newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore bunkers maintain levels despite lull.
newsitem.headline: Singapore bunkers maintain levels despite lull.

text.p: Singapore bunker sellers maintained their levels on Monday on the back of the firm cargo market, in spite of the lull in demand, traders said.
"It is the typical Monday...very quiet," said a major. "But sellers are unlikely to lower offers with the cargo market still strong and crude up."
Bunker 380-cst was quoted in a wide range of $97-$100 per tonne and the 180-cst $4 higher. MDO and gas oil were also widely quoted at around $163-$175 and $173-$180 respectively.
